text:
Disabling does make
the update no longer applicable. If you're not using WinRE (there's no WinRE
partition), there's no need for the update. The recovery environment is not
required and poses an ongoing security risk for a secure platform. Since most
businesses will just wipe & reload anyway it's really not necessary to have it
there. -S
Link: None

metadata.subject: RE: [patchmanagement] You may hit a 0x80070643 - ERROR_INSTALL_FAILURE
metadata.email_text_original:
[You don't often get email from patchmanagement.org@12pd.com. Learn why this is
important at https://aka.ms/LearnAboutSenderIdentification ] Disabling does make
the update no longer applicable. If you're not using WinRE (there's no WinRE
partition), there's no need for the update. The recovery environment is not
required and poses an ongoing security risk for a secure platform. Since most
businesses will just wipe & reload anyway it's really not necessary to have it
there. -S
Link: None
metadata.evaluated_noun_chunks: ['the update', 'no WinRE\npartition', 'an ongoing security risk', 'a secure platform']
metadata.noun_chunks: ['the update', 'no WinRE\npartition', 'an ongoing security risk', 'a secure platform']
